required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Different Doses (Mass) of Local Anesthetic on Duration of Adductor Canal Block in Healthy Volunteers - Part 2
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Different Doses (Mass) of Local Anesthetic on Duration of Adductor Canal Block in Healthy Volunteers - Part 2

brief_summary.textblock:
To investigate whether increased dose of local anesthetic (lidocaine) increases duration of peripheral nerve block (adductor canal block) and to develop a model for assessing duration of peripheral nerve blockades. The investigators hypothesize that increasing the dose of lidocaine (by increased concentration) will increase the duration of an adductor canal block.
The study is a follow up on an identical study (SM1-PJ-13, EudraCT number: 2013-001822-24 ) made earlier with different concentrations of lidocaine and a placebo group. For further information see trial registration at European Union Drug Regulatory Authorities Clinical Trial System.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Duration of sensory block assessed with pinprick.
primary_outcome.description: Duration is defined as the time from block performance until recovery of sensation to pin-prick stimulus, assessed at 30 and 60 minutes post block, and thereafter every hour.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of sensory block assessed by heat pain detection threshold
secondary_outcome.description: Duration is defined as time from block performance until recovery of normal sensation (+/- 2 degrees Celsius from preblock value) assessed at 30 and 60 minutes post block, and thereafter every hour.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of sensory block assessed by warmth detection threshold
secondary_outcome.description: Duration is defined as time from block performance until recovery of normal sensation (return to baseline value + 2 degrees Celsius or less from preblock value) assessed at 30 and 60 minutes post block, and thereafter every hour.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of sensory block assessed by pain during 1 minute of warmth stimulation
secondary_outcome.description: Duration is defined as time from block performance until recovery of normal sensation (return to baseline VAS pain scores +/-10 mm from preblock value) assessed at 30 and 60 minutes post block, and thereafter every hour.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of sensory block assessed by tolerance to transcutaneal electrical stimulation
secondary_outcome.description: Duration is defined as time from block performance until recovery of normal sensation (return to baseline preblock value) assessed at 30 and 60 minutes post block, and thereafter every hour.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of sensory block assessed by cold sensation with an alcohol swab
secondary_outcome.description: Duration is defined as time from block performance until recovery of normal sensation assessed at 30 and 60 minutes post block, and thereafter every hour.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of motor block assessed as maximum voluntary isometric contraction.
secondary_outcome.description: Duration is defined as time from block performance until recovery of normal muscle strength, assessed at 30 and 60 minutes post block, and thereafter every hour.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to onset of sensory block assessed by pinprick.
secondary_outcome.description: Onset is defined as the time from block performance until loss of sensation to pin-prick stimulus assessed at 30 and 60 minutes post block, and thereafter every hour.

arm_group.description: Adductor canal block (ACB) with 20 ml lidocaine 5 mg/ml, single bolus
Adductor canal block with 20 ml lidocaine 15 mg/ml, single bolus

intervention.intervention_name: Adductor canal block with 20 ml lidocaine, single bolus
intervention.description: Duration of an adductor canal block with 20 ml lidocaine, single bolus, administered as 5 or 15 mg/ml

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA 1
- Body mass index 18-25
Exclusion Criteria:
- Allergy to study medication
- Earlier trauma or surgery to lower limb
- Diabetes Mellitus

facility.name: Rigshospitalet, Centre of Head and Orthopaedics, Department of Anaesthesia
